document.masterDocTitle: Climbing plants of a fragmented area of lowland Atlantic Forest, Igarassu, Pernambuco (northeastern Brazil)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Climbing plants of a fragmented area of lowland Atlantic Forest, Igarassu, Pernambuco (northeastern Brazil)

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Programa de Pós-Graduação em Biologia Vegetal, Dept. Botânica, Universidade Federal de Pernambuco. CEP: 50670 - 901, Recife, Pernambuco, Brazil; e-mail: diogoambientais @ yahoo. com. br
Dept. Botânica, Universidade Federal de Pernambuco. CEP: 50670 - 901, Recife, Pernambuco, Brazil.

heading.emphasis: Key to the identification of the climbing plants of Igarassu based on fruiting material

paragraph.keyLead: 4. Leaflets without dark glands, branches of the inflorescence cylindrical in cross-section ............................................ 5

8. Basal third of the leaflet connate; fruit indehiscent
..................................................................... Phanera trichosepala

8. Basal two-thirds of the leaflets connate; fruit dehiscent
.................................................................. Phanera outimouta

13. Stem 4-angulate in cross-section; petiole with 2-6 sessile glands
........................................................ Passiflora alata

13. Stem cylindrical in cross-section; petiole with 2 stalked glands
..................................................... Passiflora galbana

keyLead.keyStep:
20. Tendrils two, in the apex of the leaf sheath ( Fig. 3G )
....................................................................... Smilax syphilitica

paragraph.keyLead:
24. Petioles to 3 cm long; leaves scabrous on the adaxial surface..........................................................
Gurania spinulosa

24. Petioles to 15 cm long; leaves pubescent on the adaxial surface.....................................................
Guranis acuminata

25. Mature fruit yellow (rarely red), indehiscent; seeds white ................................................................
Cayaponia tayuya

29. Plants pubscent to scrabous; fruit borne in racemes .....................................................................
Gurania bignoniacea

31. Leaf margin entire; wings of the fruit obovate, apiculate................................................................
Paullinia racemosa

31. Leaf margin dentate; wings of the fruit elliptical, not apiculate ........................................................
Paullinia trigonia

32. Stem flattened in cross-section; leaves pinnate ........................................................................
Machaerium aculeatum

33. Fruit divided into three oblong-winged samaras .......................................................................
Serjania subinpunctata

33. Fruit divided into three ovate-winged samaras............................................................................
Serjania salzmaniana

39. Leaves scabrous, glands 2-6, distributed along the midvein ............................................................
Mandevilla scabra

39. Leaves not scabrous, glands 2-6 grouped at the base of the midvein ................................................
Matelea maritima

40. Leaf covered with long fine hairs; fruit divided into 3 samaras ...........................................
Stigymaphyllon blanchetii

41. Fruits grouped into a capitate compound infrutescence ......................................................................
Mikania obovata

43. Wings less than three times the length of the fruit....................................................................
Niendenzuela acutifolia
43. Wings as long as or longer than three times the length of the fruit ............................................................................ 44

51. Raphe unarmed, leaflets unarmed or sometimes armed with thorns at the basis of the leaflets; apex of bracts covered in narrow thorns ( Fig. 4B ) .....................................................................................................
Desmoncus orthacanthos

51. Raphe and abaxial surface of the leaflets armed with stiff and twisted thorns; apex of bracts covered in pustular thorns ( Fig. 4C )
...................................................................................................................... Desmoncus polyacanthos

62. Stems bearing lenticels, glabrous; leaflets lanceolate; calyx persistent in fruit
............................. Connarus blanchetii

62. Stem lacking lenticels, hairy; leaflets ovate; calyx not persistent
............................................. Rynchosia pyramidalis

65. Plants glabrous; bracteoles stiff, adpressed to the rachis
........................................................................... Vigna luteola

66. Lobes of the calyx of unequal length ( Fig. 4D ); fruit with urticating hairs…
.................................... Mucuna pruriens

70. Fruits arranged into a capitate compound inflorescence
....................................................... Cyrtocymura scorpioides
70. Fruits protected by two persistent, bright involucral bracts, not arranged into a capitulum ...................................... 71

72. Stipules linear-subulate; seed rough, dark-brown ( Fig 4F )
................................................... Dalechampia brasiliensis

72. Stipules reniform; seeds smooth, light-brown ( Fig 4F )
.................................................. Dalechampia pernambucensis
73. Plant bearing urticating hairs; fruit a 3-lobed capsule; a single seed per locule......................................................... 74
73. Plant not bearing urticating hairs; fruit 3-lobed or not, where 3-lobed more than one seed per locule ..................... 75

78. Apical third of the leaflets connate; bracts linear-lanceolate
....................................................... Phanera trichosepala

78. Basal third of the leaflets connate; bracts reniform
......................................................................... Phanera outimouta

80. Fruits 1-winged; one seed per fruit, spherical
............................................................................ Securidaca diversifolia
85. Sepals persistent, equal in size, not surrounding the fruit; seeds without a white aril ............................................... 87

87. Fruits born in axillary or cauliflorous glomerules
....................................................................... Doliocarpus dentatus

89. Leaves sagitate; inner surface of sepals with liguliform appendix
................................................... Ipomoea bahiensis

92. Fruits regulary dehiscent; seeds with two surfaces flat, one convex
.................................................. Ipomoea obscura

93. Fruits 4-valved, each valve dividing into two
................................................................ Jacquemontia menispermoides
